alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 01 at 4:30AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...POTENTIAL FOR FREEZING RAIN TONIGHT AND THURSDAY NIGHT... Temperatures begin to cool tonight as light precipitation spreads inland of the coast. A brief period of light freezing rain early Thursday morning across the Kuskokwim Delta will be possible. However, there is some uncertainty that Wednesday night low temperatures will dip to freezing or below. Temperatures rebound during the day Thursday and it isn`t until Thursday night when a much cooler air mass moves into Southwest Alaska. Thus, the better chance for freezing precipitation will likely hold off until late Thursday/early Friday. The biggest caveat will entail timing of decreasing precipitation early Friday coincident with much colder temperatures developing. As it stands, any freezing rain is currently expected to be intermittent with limited coverage, and only trace amounts of ice to a few hundredths of an inch at best.
